title: NOTHING IS WORKING. What is going on with this thing

content:

Thunderbird failed to find the settings for your email account. Hostname empty or invalid. Only letters, numbers, - and . are allowed

However, when you put the word mail.websitename.com, it still does not work. It jumps to smpt and then when you do it again, it switches to imap. Something is wrong with it and then I tried another account and I get this message:

Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.sunset-daily.com failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

What is happening to it?

title: latest update breaks thunderbird - Content snap command-chain for /snap/thunderbird/791/gpu-2404/bin/gpu-2404-provider-wrapper not found: ensure slot is connected
creator: paull1
content:
If I invoke thunderbird from the cmdline (Linux) this is what I get: 

   Content snap command-chain for /snap/thunderbird/791/gpu-2404/bin/gpu-2404-provider-wrapper not found: ensure slot is connected

This was after installing the latest update - mozilla package update. I tried re-installing the Ubuntu package with "sudo apt remove thunderbird" and then "sudo apt install thunderbird". Nothing changes, same behavior.

Without thunderbird able to run, I fear that it will also be unable to provide an update to fix the broken package. I don't know what to try next. Please help.

title: Anyone else have Emails going from Inbox to a Subfolder since last Thunderbird Update?
creator: chochian
content:
Since TB update 140.1, my emails coming into Inbox sit there for a few seconds, then move to a subfolder I have under the inbox for my Orders. My account is a Microsoft Exchange Account working with Owl. The emails are also doing the same thing in Outlook too. The only difference is when I reroute the emails back to inbox, in Outlook they go there and you can see them. In Thunderbird, the emails disappear from the subfolder and are nowhere to be found. They don't show in Inbox or anywhere else.

I have asked Microsoft, in Thunderbird Community before, and Owl, and no one has any help. I finally resorted to AI and it gave me lots of things to try but none worked. I tried repairing folders, making a new profile (problem replicated itself in the new profile as well), and so many things of which nothing helped. I have lots of different folders and message filters and all worked well for years until this update. It's a specific issue with the Inbox because I can forward messages into other folders and they will go and be visible there, but when it comes to inbox, they disappear.

My AI searches have stated that this has been a known issue, yet Owl seems to be clueless. Usually they will fix things within a few days, but this issue still persists after weeks. Does anyone else have this problem and a solution to try? This is really messing up my workflow and I don't want to miss any important emails.

Thanks in advance!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/139.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/139.0.0.0

title: Can't write to IMAP folders on gmail
creator: ari.erev
content:
Hello,

This worked with no problems for many months.

Recently, probably only starting today, Thunderbird complains about inability to write to Drafts (or any other IMAP folders).

When writing a new message, after certain number of character entered to the message body, a "copying message to Drafts folder...." is presented at the bottom.

This message at the bottom of the screen does not go away... it is just stuck there (and the email message does not appear in the Drafts folder, on gmail). (as I said, it used to be fine, until today).

In some cases, also a pop-up is presented that says that Thunderbird can't write to the draft folder, and suggest to write to a local folder. (That's really nice, but not what I want...)

I tried, some solutions, such as making sure the folder name is "Subscibed" and doing a a right-click on the folder name and then Settings-->Repair Folder - but this does not help.

READING from the imap folder seems to work fine. I see new messages arriving at my gmail Inbox folder in Thunderbird.

Any idea? Is there a way to debug this to understand if this is a network error (????) or some wrong behaivor on the side of the gmail imap server?

Any guidance on how to provide more information in order to help the experts provide a solution/fix is most welcome...

Thanks! Ari
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/139.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Thunderbird version 128 - Modificare Threading predefinito
creator: francesco.borazzo
content:
Thunderbird vers. 128 Windows 11 x64

Voglio modificare la modalità di Threading predefinita, sono andato in Strumenti/Impostazioni/Generale/Editor di configurazione

ho selezionato la preferenza in impostazioni avanzate: mailnews.default_view_flags cambiando 1 --> 0

non esiste pulsante Salva (come scritto nelle istruzioni) ho dato Invio e fatto clic su X di Impostazioni avanzate poi fatto clic su X di Impostazioni

Ho chiuso l'App Thunderbird e l'ho riaperta ma non è cambiato nulla nella visualizzazione dei Threading.

Ho commesso qualche errore? Cosa devo fare per eliminare il Threading?

Grazie, Francesco Borazzo

title: Google Login Nuisance Screen
creator: rhhutchins
content:
I am being plagued - AGAIN - by the google login screen from Hell!

How can I get rid of it? I searched online and found instructions to open my google account and change settings to disallow signing in to other apps via google. The instructions didn't match the options offered by the google webpage. I disabled the option to allow signing in with Android devices (I don't have any Android devices unless one of my IoT devices is Android.) I could find no other options to changes except some relating to Chrome, which I use only for web development testing.

I tried to login here as usual using 2 different gmail.com domain email accounts: neither worked. I presumed that the damned google screen from Hell was blocking them; so I set up this login that doesn't use a gmail.com domain.

I tried to send a test email from a gmail.com domain email address to other addresses using the gmail domain and to addresses that do not use the gmail domain. The test ran for several minutes without completing. The only mail I have received in TBird is to the non-gmail domain.

3 questions: 1) How do I get rid of the google login screen? 2) Is it blocking email? 3) How do I get TBird to work again with all my email addys?
